Schedule.description: The schedule with which any execution would happen.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

values.name: OneTime
values.description: The schedule will execute only once.

values.name: Day
values.description: The schedule will execute every day.

values.name: Hour
values.description: The schedule will execute every hour.

values.name: Week
values.description: The schedule will execute every week.

values.name: Month
values.description: The schedule will execute every month.

values.name: Minute
values.description: The schedule will execute every minute.

startTime.description: The start time of the schedule. DateLiteral using ISO8601, per 1API guidelines.

expiryTime.description: The end time of the schedule. DateLiteral using ISO8601, per 1API guidelines.

initialDelayMilliSeconds.description: Number of units of time to delay before the first execution.

values.name: FixedDelay
values.description: The schedule will execute with a fixed period between the end of the last invocation and the start of the next.

values.name: FixedInterval
values.description: The schedule will execute at a fixed period between invocations.

advancedSchedule.description: The advanced schedule of the schedule.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the schedule.

StateCondition.description:
Condition is a abstraction to convey details of what lead the entity into the current state.
For example - When a new test is in failed state, the condition could be used to convey 'Execution Agent unreachable'.

code.description: The code for the current state condition of the test execution.

details.description: The human readable details for the this condition of the test execution.

lastModifiedAt.description: The timestamp of when the state condition was last updated.

author.description: Author (Email Id) of the Test package.

license.description: License under which this package is released. E.g., MIT.

dependencies.description:
Lists the dependencies required by the package. e.g., 
```[{"iperf3":"3.9.0"}]```

executor.description: Specifies the underlying executor for the package.

language.description: The language used to implement the package.

commands.description: Contains commands to manage the package lifecycle.

installationCommand.description:
Command to install the package dependencies and setup. e.g.,
```"Install-Module -Name Az -AllowClobber -Force; Invoke-WebRequest -Uri 'https://iperf.fr/download/iperf_3.9.0/iperf3.exe' -OutFile 'C:\iperf3.exe'"```

executionCommand.description: Command to execute the main functionality of the package.

cleanupCommand.description: Command to cleanup the package after execution.
